com.sun.tools.visualvm.host.model

Class HostOverview

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sun.tools.visualvm.core.model.Model
      • com.sun.tools.visualvm.host.model.HostOverview

  • public abstract class HostOverview
extends Model
    This class uses available JVM APIs to obtatin various information about operating system and host on which the Java virtual machine is running.
    Author:
    Tomas Hurka

    • Method Detail

      • getArch

        public abstract String getArch()
        Returns the operating system architecture. This method is equivalent to System.getProperty("os.arch").
        Returns:
        the operating system architecture.
        See Also:
        System.getProperty(java.lang.String)

      • getAvailableProcessors

        public abstract int getAvailableProcessors()
        Returns the number of processors available to the Java virtual machine. This method is equivalent to the Runtime.availableProcessors() method.

        This value may change during a particular invocation of the virtual machine.

        Returns:
        the number of processors available to the virtual machine; never smaller than one.

      • getFreePhysicalMemorySize

        public abstract long getFreePhysicalMemorySize()
        The number of currently available bytes of physical memory.
        Returns:
        the number of currently available bytes of physical memory; never smaller than one.

      • getFreeSwapSpaceSize

        public abstract long getFreeSwapSpaceSize()
        The number of currently available bytes of swap space.
        Returns:
        the number of currently available bytes of swap space; never smaller than one.

      • getName

        public abstract String getName()
        Returns the operating system name. This method is equivalent to System.getProperty("os.name").
        Returns:
        the operating system name.
        See Also:
        System.getProperty(java.lang.String)

      • getSystemLoadAverage

        public abstract double getSystemLoadAverage()
        Returns the system load average for the last minute. The system load average is the sum of the number of runnable entities queued to the available processors and the number of runnable entities running on the available processors averaged over a period of time. The way in which the load average is calculated is operating system specific but is typically a damped time-dependent average.

        If the load average is not available, a negative value is returned.

        This method is designed to provide a hint about the system load and may be queried frequently. The load average is not available on Windows platform.

        Returns:
        the system load average; or a negative value if not available.

      • getTotalPhysicalMemorySize

        public abstract long getTotalPhysicalMemorySize()
        The total number of bytes of physical memory.
        Returns:
        the total number of bytes of physical memory; never smaller than one.

      • getTotalSwapSpaceSize

        public abstract long getTotalSwapSpaceSize()
        The total number of bytes of swap space.
        Returns:
        the total number of bytes of swap space; never smaller than one.

        public abstract String getVersion()
